reviews.text: This is the 2nd time we have been to the Pinar, it is a small basic hotel, extremely clean, and the staff very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are basic but have everything that you need. We had a problem with our original room, but we were moved to another the same day without any hassle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I respect all the reviews that have been written about the Pinar Hotel however are you really sure you stayed at the hotel we stayed at?!!
reviews.title: Are you having a laugh?!

reviews.text: Having said that you do get what you paid for and the holiday as a whole was very cheap so no arguments there. I would class the Pinar as a very basic 2 star hotel if not a 1 star - we have stayed in many 2 star hotels in Turkey and Greece and this was by far the most basic. The rooms were small and dark (definitely in need of redecoration) and the blanket in the room looked like it was full of dust mites - I couldn't touch it - yuk! The room was relatively clean. The cleaner was lovely though and she made the beds every day. I just didn't like walking around in bare feet as you picked up other people's hair (new mop needed I think). The pool is very small but clean. The people on reception (in particular the young girl who was always smiling) were really lovely and helpful.
reviews.title: fun fun fun and more fun

reviews.text: Bed & Breakfast is a con - it's crap and there's not very much of it and the tea, well it was stewed rubbish! We have learnt our lesson and will most probably go self-catering in future. At least then you are more likely to get a fridge (yes no fridge so be warned) and would be able to bring food and drink into the hotel (we got told off on our last day for drinking a 2 litre bottle of water by the pool because we bought it from the local supermarket- what a joke!). It would be so cheap to buy your own food and at least it would be yummy and probably more variety!
reviews.title: LOVED IT

reviews.text: Alanya itself is very nice. The people are really friendly, there's lots to see and do. It is huge so if you're craving a quiet holiday then Alanya will not be for you. Apparently the shopping is ace but it was far too hot to shop!
reviews.title: Very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bests parts of the holiday was the hour boat trip (first boat in the harbour as you walk towards the Centre) - the people who ran the boat were really lovely and they had 2 fab dogs - Angel you were lush! And lazing by theThe Cleopatra beach is the best - and the sea was glorious once you get past the little bits of seaweed and watch out for the bubbles (I assume waste from the large boat trips gets tipped into the sea - real shame). The food is awsome and the best restaurant for us was the Mexican - El Diva (I think that's the name - next to McDonalds). If you come across a very nice man with a grey beard wearing a black hat (head waiter/owner?) then you're in the right place. They also have live music every night which was good. You are spoilt for choice for restaurants and food so that's the least of your worries.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with potential
